Test_Root

Interface IGame

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GameAdaptor

    public interface IGame
    Interface for use in testing high-level game systems in a Warlords-like game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isFinished()
      Determine if the game has finished.
      void setTimeRemaining(int seconds)
      Set the time remaining in the game to the given value in seconds.
      void tick()
      A tick advances the state of the game world by a small time increment, i.e.

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        void tick()
        A tick advances the state of the game world by a small time increment, i.e. one frame. The ball (and all other objects) should move according to their velocity, player inputs should be handled (but are not tested here), collisions should be detected and processed, game end conditions should be checked, and so on.

      • isFinished

        boolean isFinished()
        Determine if the game has finished. Results need only be valid before the start and after the end of a game tick.
        Returns:
        true if no more than one warlord remains alive, or if the time remaining is less than or equal to zero. Otherwise, return false.

      • setTimeRemaining

        void setTimeRemaining(int seconds)
        Set the time remaining in the game to the given value in seconds.
        Parameters:
        seconds -
